abstract_summ: Objectives The objective of the study was to conduct a follow-up investigation of 10 asymptomatic patients at diagnosis among the 98 confirmed COVID-19 cases reported in Busan between February 21 and March 13, 2020 to determine whether asymptomatic infection and transmission during asymptomatic period are possible.Methods The study analyzed 10 asymptomatic, confirmed COVID-19 cases to determine whether asymptomatic infection is possible.Results Among the 98, confirmed COVID-19 cases reported in Busan, the study analyzed 10 (10.2%) asymptomatic patients at diagnosis.This study aims to present the clinical characteristics of 24 cases with asymptomatic infection screened from close contacts and to show the transmission potential of asymptomatic COVID-19 virus carriers.This study aims to present the clinical characteristics of 24 cases with asymptomatic infection screened from close contacts and to show the transmission potential of asymptomatic COVID-19 virus carriers.
title_summ: Seroprevalence against COVID-19 and follow-up of suspected cases in primary health care in SpainClinical Characteristics of 24 Asymptomatic Infections with COVID-19 Screened among Close Contacts in Nanjing, ChinaEpidemiological characterization of asymptomatic carriers of COVID-19 in ColombiaHigh transmissibility of COVID-19 near symptom onsetClinical characteristics of 24 asymptomatic infections with COVID-19 screened among close contacts in Nanjing, ChinaFollow up investigation of asymptomatic COVID-19 cases at diagnosis in Busan, Korea.
